Sentencas: The performance improvement of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) system by replacing a conventional reformer with a palladium membrane reactor is investigated using 1 D modeling.
Titulo: Performance improvement of solid oxide fuel cell system using palladium membrane reactor with different operation modes

Sentencas: When pure hydrogen is extracted from the reaction mixture via the palladium membrane, the power density of the SOFC is improved, depending on the value of hydrogen recovery (xi).
Titulo: Performance improvement of solid oxide fuel cell system using palladium membrane reactor with different operation modes

Sentencas: Three operation modes of membrane reactors; i.e., high-pressure compressor (HPC-MR), combined low pressure compressor and vacuum pump (LPC-MR-V) and combined high-pressure compressor and vacuum pump (HPC-MR-V) are considered.
Titulo: Performance improvement of solid oxide fuel cell system using palladium membrane reactor with different operation modes

Sentencas: Their overall SOFC system characteristics are compared with those of the SOFC system with the conventional reformer.
Titulo: Performance improvement of solid oxide fuel cell system using palladium membrane reactor with different operation modes

Sentencas: The economic analysis reveals that the total capital cost/net electrical power is dependent on hydrogen recovery, net electrical efficiency and operation mode.
Titulo: Performance improvement of solid oxide fuel cell system using palladium membrane reactor with different operation modes

Sentencas: At high electrical efficiency, the replacement of the conventional reformer with the membrane reactor becomes attractive.
Titulo: Performance improvement of solid oxide fuel cell system using palladium membrane reactor with different operation modes

Sentencas: Finally, it is demonstrated that the HPC-MR-V is the best operation mode for integration with the SOFC system.
Titulo: Performance improvement of solid oxide fuel cell system using palladium membrane reactor with different operation modes
